abstract.para: This file provides documentation for file 92BOMONT.DAT, an ASCII file that contains final data for bryophyte (Hygrohypnum, Schistidium, and Fontinalis) tissue phosphorus and nitrogen concentrations in control and phosphorus fertilized reaches of the Kuparuk River in 1992.

intellectualRights.para: Acceptance and utilization of LTER data requires that:

listitem.para: The Principal Investigator be sent a notice stating reasons for acquiring any data and a description of the publication intentions.
The Principal Investigator of the data set be sent a copy of the report or manuscript prior to submission and be adequately cited in any resultant publications
A copy of any resultant publications should be sent to:Principal Investigator Ecosystems Center Marine Biological Laboratory Woods Hole, MA 02543

geographicCoverage.geographicDescription: Kuparuk River: Control: 0.5 to -1.0 km Fertilized: 1.0 to 6.0 km

description.para:
For Archival Use:
DATE RECEIVED: June 1997 DATA FILE ENTERED BY: Karie Slavik DATA FILE VALIDATION: NAME: Karie Slavik DATE: 03Sept97

para.literalLayout: Three mosses common in the P fertilized reach of the Kuparuk River (Hygrohypnum spp., Schistidium agassizii, Fontinalis neomexicana) were grown under control and P fertilized conditions in 1992 (methods described in 92BOMOGR.DOC, data in 92BOMOGR.DAT). Total phosphorus and nitrogen concentrations in bryophyte clumps were determined from oven- dried samples. Initial bryophyte stocks (collected July 5) and all clumps from each treatment (control and fertilized, collected 8 August), were combined by species and treatment. Pooled samples were ground in a Wiley Mill to pass a #20 mesh. Triplicate 0.25 g subsamples were digested at 440 C with sulfuric acid and hydrogen peroxide. Digested samples were diluted with deionized water and analyzed for total phosphorus with an autoanalyser. Two standard materials with well-known total phosphorus and nitrogen concentrations (National Institute of Standards and Technology citrus leaves and an internal laboratory standard material) were used to assure accuracy of the analyses.

Notes: These data should not be released to any party without the written permission of William B. Bowden. (11) VARIABLE DESCRIPTIONS: Precise Coded? Variable Variable description Units (Y/N) SITE site of measurement y D/D river kilometer mark 0.05 n DATE date ddmmyy n LOCATION CONTROL, +P n SUBSITE POOL, RUN, or RIFFLE n SPECIES bryophyte species n %P percent phosphorus n %N percent nitrogen n COMMENTS data specific comments n

Reference Citations: Bowden, W.B., J.C. Finlay, and P.E. Maloney. 1994. Long-term effects of PO4 enrichment on the distribution of bryophytes in an arctic stream. Freshwater Biology 32:445-454. Finlay, J.C. and W.B. Bowden. 1994. Controls on production of bryophytes in an arctic tundra stream. Freshwater Biology 32:455-466.
